page.title: 05DEEPING ST.JAMES HEDGES
page.content: We went down Back Lane to see how old the hedge was.We had a look to see how many main species of trees we could find.We found two,hawthorn and ash,so according to Hooper's Hedge Hypothesis the hedge is roughly two hundred years old. A long time ago there was a law saying that each person would be given a field and they must put a boundary round it. Most people in our area decided to put a hedge around their field.Some fields have got dykes round them.This is to help with drainage,as the land is so low lying. While we were there we saw some willow warblers,sparrows,blackbirds and a pied wagtail. We didn't collect any species of mini beasts because the dyke was in the way.
